one.title: AI takes over the boiler room
one.text: Proptech Dabbel has developed software that uses artificial intelligence (AI) to make building control much more efficient. Additional hardware does not have to be installed for this.

two.title: Making existing stock green should be the top priority
two.text: Addressing existing stock should be the priority for sustainability-minded companies,  delegates heard at Real Asset Media’s Impact & ESG: Effective Strategies for Real Estate briefing, which was held online this week on the REALX.Global platform.

three.title: PropTech Start Up DABBEL raises €3.6m in a financing round
three.text: DABBEL, a pioneering energy efficiency PropTech based out of Germany announces a €3.6 million Pre-Series A funding round led by Target Global, alongside Main Incubator (Commerzbank’s early-stage investment arm), SeedX and strategic angel investors.

four.title: Making the building portfolio climate-fit with artificial intelligence
four.text: Sustainable and efficient building management is increasingly becoming the focus of legislators, investors, owners and tenants - after all, the real estate sector accounts for around 40 percent of global greenhouse gas emissions.

five.title: Presenting: our second 2021 cohort
five.text: We are proud to announce the second cohort of ENECHANGE Insight Ventures (EIV) 2021. 15 companies have been selected to participate in our energy venture innovation programme, which has been running successfully since 2018 and is now held virtually.
